OK guys something needs to happen asap. This is a waste of time. Mike agreed to give directorship out of hands to get things more organized and he is still showing willingness. The problem is, nothing changed in organization... Only a little PR and lifting on Mikes succes and work but he is still the only one doing anything atm. I have seen a lot of nice and enthousiastic fellas on this topic, but I think we need someone assertive, someone with organization skills. Flightmamicah, you sure you don't want to do this?

im sure someone will pick up on it if they enjoy the mod and want to make it work.

on a side note I added thrusters to booster separator for improved ejection. I blew my wings off with the booster last time.

trying to find a good medium

Sure, no problem, glad to be helpful.

The Download Link Has Been Removed, As Has Any Other Redirection Link To Media-Fire Github etc. KerbalStuff Currently Has A Very Outdated Version. Could You Please Post A Redirect Or Download Link? Also Is There A Possibility For Four Different Packs To Be Hosted?

1)Containing : The Shuttle And The Extra's For Just The Shuttle ( The Carriers and Rotator Etc)

2)Containing : The 747 And Extensions.

3)Containing : The Dream Glider And All Remaining Parts

4)Containing : AIO (All In One) Master Pack.

It Would Help Those Of Us Trying To Keep Parts Manageable Within KSP, Also It Would Help Others With Memory Usage As The Current Full Boar Package Is A Little Heavy On The Ram For Other Users Using a Non Linux Build. (Even With Active Texture Management)

Lastly, If You Need Any Help With Textures, Feel Free To Give Me A Heads Up. I Have Had Plenty Of Graphic Design Experience Inclusive Of Maya ( 3D Graphic Animation). It Would Be Really Rewarding To Work On The Shuttle.

[email protected]

The Current Re Develop Is Looking Really Good. I Think With A Decent Hd Series Of IVA Textures and some more detail on the ET And TPS it could look pretty special. The SRB Decouplers Are Definite Much Easier To Handle Now!

Sure, no problem, glad to be helpful.
